sentence.text: Berthon was livid at one of his cars being butchered but had to acknowledge that it handled better .
She was absolutely livid .
` He was livid .
Kisling was livid , and with the help of some friends managed to grab the sculptor and throw him down the stairwell from the seventh floor .
One farmer was livid that he could not go into his local National Park and chop wood for his barbecue .
Livid with rage , he grabs their cameras and rips the film from them , tearing it to shreds and throwing it in the fire .
He turned a livid , stubbled face to the crowd .
His face was livid , and his hand had clapped to his sword .
` Pa would 've been livid with me for getting pregnant , and he would n't want his precious fiddle going to pay for anything to do with it . "
No-one could have told from his face that he was absolutely livid with Sukey , but he did n't want a row , which would upset Daisy and gee Perdita up before the interview .
Tabitha Campbell-Black was livid because she won a bag of Bailey 's Performance Mix horse feed rather than a T-shirt with a picture of a polo pony on the front .
Mansell was livid and admitted he ran away from the scene of the accident to avoid being tempted into big trouble .
Mr Brown was livid at the way £1 billion in precious foreign reserves was poured down the drain during the sterling fiasco a fortnight ago .
City fans are still livid over the clash with Bull that led to skipper Steve Walsh 's sending off in the 3-0 defeat at Molineux three weeks ago .
The Sheffield Wednesday striker was livid at finding himself back on the bench just 28 minutes after being sent on as a second-half substitute at Norwich on Saturday .
LIVID Mia Farrow beat her adopted daughter Soon-Yi with a chair after finding out about her affair with Woody Allen , it was claimed yesterday .
His face was livid and bloody .
` He 's livid about Opal . "
And then of course , silly girl , she went and told him -- he was so livid he would n't have nothing more to do with her . "
He was on his feet , the chair toppling over behind him , his face livid , his knuckles white-ridged and aimed at her .
Sly was left feeling absolutely livid .
Benedict was on his feet , overturning his chair in one violent gesture , a face of livid fury turned on Theda .
He dipped the cotton wool in the water and dabbed at the livid puffy eyes .
Wayne will be livid when he hears .
